test_description: This test covers various specialized operating systems including distributed, real-time, embedded, and mobile operating systems.

questions.question: What is the main characteristic of an open-source operating system?
questions.options_a: Its source code is publicly available and can be modified
questions.options_c: It only runs on specific hardware
questions.options_d: It doesn't require an operating system

questions.question: What is the main difference between a distributed OS and a network OS?
questions.options_a: Distributed OS presents a single-system image, network OS doesn't
questions.options_c: Distributed OS only runs on supercomputers

questions.question: What is the primary characteristic of an embedded operating system?
questions.options_a: Designed to perform specific tasks on dedicated hardware
questions.options_b: Capable of running multiple applications simultaneously

questions.question: What is the main requirement for a real-time operating system (RTOS)?
Which of the following is NOT a common feature of mobile operating systems?
What is the main advantage of cloud operating systems?
questions.options_a: Accessibility from anywhere with internet connection
questions.options_b: Higher processing power than desktop OS

questions.question: What is the primary concern for IoT operating systems?
questions.options_a: Low power consumption and small footprint

questions.question: Which of the following is a characteristic of multimedia operating systems?
questions.options_a: Support for real-time processing of audio and video
questions.options_d: Inability to handle multiple media streams

questions.question: What is the main difference between hard and soft real-time systems?
questions.options_a: Hard real-time cannot miss deadlines, soft real-time can tolerate some misses
questions.options_d: Hard real-time only runs on supercomputers

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a common challenge in distributed operating systems?
What is the main advantage of a microkernel architecture for embedded systems?
Which of the following is a common requirement for IoT operating systems?
What is the main characteristic of a proprietary operating system?
questions.options_a: Owned by a company that controls its use and modification
